1.name: Casablanca
1.description: A cynical American expatriate struggles to decide whether or not he should help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape French Morocco.

2.name: Bambi
2.description: The story of a young deer growing up in the forest.

3.name: Cat People
3.description: An American man marries a Serbian immigrant who fears that she will turn into the cat person of her homeland's fables if they are intimate together.

4.name: Pacific Rendezvous
4.description: Anxious to see some naval action in the Pacific during WWII, Lt. Bill Gordon makes the mistake of telling his new girlfriend, ditzy Elaine Carter, that he was an expert in deciphering codes...                See full summary »

5.name: Mrs. Miniver
5.description: A British family struggles to survive the first months of World War II.

6.name: Jungle Book
6.description: A boy raised by wolves tries to adapt to human village life.

7.name: I Married a Witch
7.description: A beautiful 17th-century witch returns to life to plague politician Wallace Wooley, descendant of her persecutor.

8.name: The Ox-Bow Incident
8.description: When a posse captures three men suspected of killing a local farmer, they become strongly divided over whether or not to lynch the men.

9.name: Moontide
9.description: After a drunken binge on the San Pablo waterfront, longshoreman Bobo fears he may have killed a man. In his uncertainty, he takes a job on an isolated bait barge. That night, he rescues ...                See full summary »

10.name: The Magnificent Ambersons
10.description: The spoiled young heir to the decaying Amberson fortune comes between his widowed mother and the man she has always loved.

11.name: Yankee Doodle Dandy
11.description: The life of the renowned musical composer, playwright, actor, dancer, and singer George M. Cohan.

12.name: The Great Man's Lady
12.description: A 100-year-old pioneer woman tells her story in flashbacks.

13.name: To Be or Not to Be
13.description: During the Nazi occupation of Poland, an acting troupe becomes embroiled in a Polish soldier's efforts to track down a German spy.

14.name: Now, Voyager
14.description: A frumpy spinster blossoms under therapy and becomes an elegant, independent woman.

15.name: Saboteur
15.description: An aircraft factory worker goes on the run after being wrongly accused of starting a fire that killed his best friend.

16.name: Deep in the Heart of Texas
16.description: Jim Mallory returns from the Civil War to Texas to find his father, Colonel Mallory, leading a band of land grabbers and carpet-baggers during the Reconstruction Era. He learns of this from...                See full summary »

17.name: The Palm Beach Story
17.description: An inventor needs cash to develop his big idea. His wife, who loves him, decides to raise it for him by divorcing him and marrying a millionaire.

18.name: Holiday Inn
18.description: At an inn which is only open on holidays, a crooner and a hoofer vie for the affections of a beautiful up-and-coming performer.

19.name: Much Too Shy
19.description: A handyman and amateur artist gets into trouble when nude female bodies are added to the heads he has drawn of prominent ladies, and are sold as soap adverts.

20.name: Flying Tigers
20.description: Capt. Jim Gordon's command of the famed American mercenary fighter group in China is complicated by the recruitment of an old friend who is a reckless hotshot.

21.name: The Ghost of Frankenstein
21.description: When Ygor brings the Monster to Dr. Ludwig Frankenstein for care, Ludwig gets the idea of replacing the Monster's current criminal brain with a normal one.

22.name: This Gun for Hire
22.description: When assassin Philip Raven shoots a blackmailer and his beautiful female companion dead, he is paid off in marked bills by his treasonous employer who is working with foreign spies.

23.name: The Glass Key
23.description: A crooked politician finds himself being accused of murder by a gangster from whom he refused help during a re-election campaign.

24.name: Random Harvest
24.description: An amnesiac World War I veteran falls in love with a music hall star, only to suffer an accident which restores his original memories but erases his post-war life.

25.name: The Pride of the Yankees
25.description: The story of the life and career of famed baseball player Lou Gehrig.

26.name: Commandos Strike at Dawn
26.description: A gentle widower, enraged at Nazi atrocities against his peaceful Norwegian fishing village, escapes to Britain and returns leading a commando force against the oppressors.

27.name: For Me and My Gal
27.description: Two vaudeville performers fall in love, but find their relationship tested by the arrival of WWI.

28.name: The Major and the Minor
28.description: A woman disguises herself as a child to save on a train fare and is taken in charge by an army man who doesn't notice the truth.

29.name: Reap the Wild Wind
29.description: Florida ship salvager, Loxi, falls for Jack, captain of a ship wrecked on the Key West shore. However, their romance is complicated by the arrival of another suitor, and eventually leads to tragedy.

30.name: The Black Swan
30.description: An ex-pirate contends with rowdy buccaneers and a love-hate relationship with an aristocratic woman who's tougher than she seems.

31.name: In This Our Life
31.description: The day before her wedding, a pampered young woman absconds with her sister's husband; in retaliation, her sister begins seeing the woman's former fiancé.

32.name: The Mad Monster
32.description: A mad scientist changes his simple-minded handyman into a werewolf in order to prove his supposedly crazy scientific theories - and exact revenge.

33.name: The Mummy's Tomb
33.description: A high priest travels to America with a living mummy to kill those who had desecrated the tomb of an Egyptian princess thirty years earlier.

34.name: You Were Never Lovelier
34.description: In Buenos Aires, a man who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age allows an American dancer to perform at his club under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter.

35.name: The Talk of the Town
35.description: An escaped prisoner and a stuffy law professor vie for the hand of a spirited schoolteacher.

36.name: The Man Who Came to Dinner
36.description: When acerbic critic Sheridan Whiteside slips on the front steps of a provincial Ohio businessman's home and breaks his hip, he and his entourage take over the house indefinitely.

37.name: Woman of the Year
37.description: Rival reporters Sam and Tess fall in love and get married, only to find their relationship strained when Sam comes to resent Tess' hectic lifestyle.

38.name: In Which We Serve
38.description: This "story of a ship", the British destroyer H.M.S. Torrin, is told in flashbacks by survivors as they cling to a life raft.

39.name: White Cargo
39.description: The story takes place at a British plantation in Africa where Tondelayo entices all the Brits, especially Harry Witzel.

40.name: Kings Row
40.description: The dark side and hypocrisy of provincial American life is seen through the eyes of five children as they grow to adulthood at the turn-of-the-century.

41.name: A Yank at Eton
41.description: During World War II, an American boy named Timothy Dennis is unwillingly sent to Eton College in the UK where he is frequently confused by the many differences between the two cultures.

42.name: Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon
42.description: Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson must protect a Swiss inventor of an advanced bomb sight from falling into German hands.

43.name: Road to Morocco
43.description: Two carefree castaways on a desert shore find an Arabian Nights city, where they compete for the luscious Princess Shalmar.

44.name: Went the Day Well?
44.description: An English village is occupied by disguised German paratroopers as an advance post for a planned invasion.

45.name: Across the Pacific
45.description: In December 1941, ex-army captain Rick Leland boards a Japanese ship heading to Asia via the Panama Canal where his Japanese hosts show interest in the American defense plans for the canal zone.

46.name: All Through the Night
46.description: Runyonesque Broadway gamblers turn patriotic when they stumble onto a cell of Nazi saboteurs.

47.name: Roxie Hart
47.description: Roxie Hart signs a murder confession in order to attract publicity for her dancing career as dames don't swing in Cook County. Will everything go as planned?

48.name: One of Our Aircraft Is Missing
48.description: When Nazi anti-aircraft fire damages a British bomber, its crew bails out and seeks help from the Dutch underground.

49.name: The Man Who Wouldn't Die
49.description: A private detective gets mixed up with a phony spiritualist racket.

50.name: The Night Has Eyes
50.description: Two teachers, man-hungry Doris and restrained Marian, visit the Yorkshire moors a year after friend Evelyn disappeared there. On a stormy night, they take refuge in the isolated cottage of ...                See full summary »
